org.cloudifysource.dsl.context
Interface Service

public interface Service

Represents a Cloudify service, accessible from the Service Context.

Since:
1.0.0
Author:
barakme

Method Summary
 ServiceInstance[] getInstances()
          Returns the instances of this service.
 String getName()
          Returns the service name.
 int getNumberOfActualInstances()
          Returns the number of actually running instances for this service.
 int getNumberOfPlannedInstances()
          Returns the number of planned instances for this service.
 Object[] invoke(String commandName, Object[] params)
          Invokes a custom command on this service.
 ServiceInstance[] waitForInstances(int howmany, long timeout, TimeUnit timeUnit)
          Waits for the specified number of instances to become available.
 

Method Detail

getName

String getName()
Returns the service name.

Returns:
service name

getNumberOfPlannedInstances

int getNumberOfPlannedInstances()
Returns the number of planned instances for this service.

Returns:
number of planned instances

getNumberOfActualInstances

int getNumberOfActualInstances()
Returns the number of actually running instances for this service.

Returns:
number of actually running instances

waitForInstances

ServiceInstance[] waitForInstances(int howmany,
                                   long timeout,
                                   TimeUnit timeUnit)
Waits for the specified number of instances to become available.

Parameters:
howmany - number of instances to wait for.
timeout - time to wait.
timeUnit - time unit to wait.
Returns:
the available instances, or null if the requested number of instances was not found. If found, the returned number of instances may be larger then the requested amount.

getInstances

ServiceInstance[] getInstances()
Returns the instances of this service.

Returns:
array of service instances

invoke

Object[] invoke(String commandName,
                Object[] params)
                throws Exception
Invokes a custom command on this service.

Parameters:
commandName - the command name.
params - the command parameters.
Returns:
The invocation results.
Throws:
Exception - if any of the invocations failed. The thrown exception is the exception thrown by the failed invocation.
